qas.question: What idea did Binford take issue with?

answers.text: that early hominids and early humans were hunters

qas.question: What did Binford conclude humans were instead of hunters?
What does confrontational scavenging involve doing to other predators after they've made a kill?
Who is the archaeologist that does not believe early humans were hunters?
Louis Binford concluded what based on skeletal remains of consumed animals?

answers.text: hominids and early humans were mostly scavengers

qas.question: Louis Binford's idea is popular among whom?
Confrontational scavenging involves doing what to other predators?

plausible_answers.text: early hominids and early humans were hunters

qas.question: What idea was criticized by Robert Blumenschine?

plausible_answers.text: skeletal remains of the consumed animals

qas.question: What did Robert Blumenschine analyze to reach his conclusion that humans were hunters?
What group is the idea of humans being hunters popular with?

plausible_answers.text: challenging and scaring off other predators

qas.question: What is the first step humans would use when hunting an animal?
What would early humans be able to obtain when hunting?
